meanings.definition: The formation of a scab on a wound.
meanings.sent1: After I fell and scraped my knee, the scabbing process started to protect the injury.
meanings.sent2: The scabbing on my cut is a sign that it is healing.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the scabbing on my elbow made it look like a tiny shield.
meanings.sent4: The scabbing on the wound was like nature's bandage, keeping it safe.
meanings.sent5: The scabbing was a visible reminder of my body's healing power.

meanings.definition: The act of betraying a group by continuing to work during a strike.
meanings.sent1: His scabbing during the strike caused tension among his coworkers.
meanings.sent2: Scabbing can lead to conflicts within the striking group.
meanings.sent3: The scabbing worker felt isolated from the rest of the employees.
meanings.sent4: Her scabbing decision was like a crack in the unity of the team.
meanings.sent5: The scabbing behavior during the strike was frowned upon by the union members.

meanings.definition: The act of healing and forming a protective crust on a wound.
meanings.sent1: The scabbing process is a natural way for the body to protect itself.
meanings.sent2: Proper care can speed up the scabbing and healing of a wound.
meanings.sent3: The scabbing on the injury looked like a tiny shield of defense.
meanings.sent4: The scabbing over the wound was like a shield guarding against infection.
meanings.sent5: The scabbing was a visible sign that the wound was on its way to recovery.
